pageTitle: Globally, 40% of total N2O emissions come from human activities
pageMain: This chart provides on a monthly basis, the amount of nitrous oxide in the atmosphere from 2001 to the present. Expressed as a mole fraction in dry air, parts per million (ppm).
p_first: Nitrous oxide is a gas that is produced by the combustion of fossil fuel and solid waste, nitrogen-base fertilizers, sewage treatment plants, natural processes, and other agricultural and industrial activities.
p_second: It is the third largest heat-trapping gas in the atmosphere and the biggest ozone-destroying compound emitted by human activities.
